item.title: June Community Update
item.description:
Hello Space Marines!

A few days ago, we released Patch 8.0 - Siege Update, including the Siege Mode, White Scars and Blood Angels Cosmetics, along with several improvements and minor changes. If you haven‚Äôt already, you should definitely read the full patch here.

Now let‚Äôs rewind a bit, and mostly: let‚Äôs discuss what‚Äôs coming as the first year of content is slowly coming to an end. Shall we?

WHAT COMES AFTER YEAR ONE? üßê

As promised, we‚Äôre excited to share more details with you, and even more will be revealed in the upcoming Community Updates this July and August. For now, here are a few things we can confirm:

We‚Äôre happy to announce that a¬†second year of both free and DLC content included in a new yearly season pass is on the way!¬†This extended support to Space Marine 2 has been possible thanks to your unwavering support, so once again, thank you very much for being part of it!. Expect new PvE missions, enemies, weapons, and‚Ä¶ more üëÄ It‚Äôs too early to provide more info, but stay tuned! üòâ

Also, to celebrate the first anniversary of the game, a large-scale update is planned for September, the 10.0 major update. Update 9.0 will not bring new content, but only balancing changes.

Unfortunately, that also means that the new PvP mode we were planning to release alongside the 9.0 update will be postponed to this big 10.0 update as well. While we can‚Äôt show you how it looks, the least we can do is to reveal what this new mode will be about:

  • This new mode will take place on a new map.

  • It will oppose 2 sides, but it won‚Äôt be Loyalist VS Chaos like in regular PvP. Instead, Chaos will face‚Ä¶ Chaos.

  • Last but not least, you‚Äôll be able to take control of the Helbrute. Yup.

As this new game mode is centered around Chaos, new Chaos armours will also be added to the game.

A new melee weapon will also be added as part of this big 10.0 Update: the Power Axe! It will have its own moveset, execution animations etc‚Ä¶ We‚Äôll show you more on this weapon later on, but here‚Äôs a first look!

Work in progress, final version is subject to change

Finally, we announced a while ago that we are working on a new class for PvE and PvP. We‚Äôre now advanced enough in its development to announce that the new class will be a Techmarine! We‚Äôll reveal more about this new class in the next community updates, so stay tuned!¬†

PATCH 8.0 IN DETAILS ‚öôÔ∏è

Patch 8.0 - Siege Update was available via the Public Test Server on Steam. Thanks to your feedback, we‚Äôve made a bunch of tweaks and improvements for the live game release of the Patch. So, thank you for your participation! Let‚Äôs briefly review the content, or read the full patch notes for more details!

SIEGE MODE

Siege Mode is the new big feature coming with the Siege Update! Check the¬†May Community Update for more details about the gameplay mechanics of this mode.

For those who played on the PTS and provided us with feedback, we heard you loud and clear! You expressed your disappointment regarding the timer. So we changed it a bit. Now, it goes as follows:

‚è±Ô∏è The timer has changed!‚è±Ô∏è

The biggest criticism regarding Siege mode from the community was the wave timer limit. It exists only for technical reasons, because killing lots of enemies causes memory fragmentation (which, to simplify, would cause a crash after a certain threshold).

We've made some optimizations so the Siege mode can last longer. Timer got reworked, instead of having a limited timer per wave that can get to a very short time on higher waves, there is a timer for the entire session and each time you beat a wave the timer increases. We've also adjusted the difficulty curve of infinite waves so enemies will get stronger faster after the 15th wave. These changes will make players die in fair combat rather than due to the timer.

Also, with some optimizations coming down later we think we can get rid of the timer entirely.

We truly hope you‚Äôre enjoying Siege Mode as much as we are and we‚Äôre still open to feedback!

WHITE SCARS CHAPTER PACK

The Assault Class Champion comes with several cosmetics and 3 exclusive weapons skins for the Occulus Bolt Carbine, the Stalker Bolt Rifle, and the Combat Knife.

[carousel][/carousel]

WHITE SCARS SUCCESSOR CHAPTERS

The White Scars Successor Chapters are the Dark Hunters, Destroyers, Mantis Warriors, Marauders, Rampagers, Solar Hawks, Storm Lords, Storm Reapers.

BLOOD ANGEL COSMETIC PACK

[carousel][/carousel]

BLOOD ANGELS SUCCESSOR CHAPTERS

The Blood Angels Successor Chapters are the Angels Penitent, Angels Sanguine, Atlantian Spears, Blood Dragons, Blood Scythes, Flesh Eaters, Flesh Tearers, and Lamenters.

TWITCH DROPS COME WITH PATCH 8.0 üìΩÔ∏è

To celebrate the release of Patch 8.0, Twitch Drops return! This time, get the Mark VIII Errant Helmet, Mark XI Hell‚Äôs Teeth Pattern Chainsword and the Porphyr Shield Bolt Pistol!

The rules go as follows: from June 25 11PM CEST to July 14 11PM CEST:¬†

  • 30min watch time of any streamer playing SM2 ‚Üí Mark VIII Errant Helmet

  • 60min watch time ‚Üí Mark XI Hell‚Äôs Teeth Pattern (Chainsword)

  • 120min watch time ‚Üí Porphyr Shield (Bolt Pistol)

RTAO & DLSS 4 SUPPORT

  • RTAO experimental feature added: enabled in-game video settings.

  • DLSS 4 provides better upscale, and multi-frame generation for 50xx series cards.

FEW CHANGES FOR PVE AND QOL IMPROVEMENTS

PVE:

  • Class and weapon perks balancing.

  • Possibility to have multiple terminus enemies spawning in Absolute Difficulty

  • Option to turn off bots in Operations and Siege mode Private Lobbies

  • Thunder Hammer on Bulwark (PvE only)

FAN CONTEST üßë‚Äçüé®

Last month we launched a Fan Art Contest with the May Community Update. You were asked to produce any piece of art related to the Campaign Mode of Space Marine 2! üé®

WryWood did it brilliantly and won 2 keys for Space Marine 2! They came up with these two adorable figures of Brother Valtus and a Tyranid in the midst of a fight!

Such a big piece must have taken a lot of time and effort so make sure you drop a nice little comment under¬†WryWood‚Äôs post, to say congrats! üéä

THAT‚ÄôS IT FOR THIS MONTH

As usual, let‚Äôs keep in touch on Discord and Focus Together. You can also follow us on our socials: Instagram X Facebook Threads Bluesky

See you on the battlefield, Space Marines.¬†

The Focus and Saber Teams. ü¶æ

item.title: Hotfix #70 (1.8.2)
item.description:
Hey Everyone,¬†

Hotfix #70 (1.8.2) is currently rolling out across our platforms. In the meantime, you can read the notes below.

General Fixes

  • Fixed banter frequency: banter has been increased for all classes during missions.¬†

  • Solved a common crash that could occur when browsing companion skins.

  • Fixed an issue that was causing the server to crash when players would step in specific locations in several missions.

  • Fixed the description of Fan the Flames blessing so that the correct values are displayed.

  • Fixed an issue that was causing weapon names to be cut off when inspecting them.

  • Fixed an issue that was preventing tagging from working properly.

  • More improvements to how cosmetics and rewards are displayed in the inventory.

  • Fixed an issue where some debug strings were visible in the tactical overlay.

  • Fixed an issue where Psyker 'on critical hit' talents would trigger when burn stacks are active on enemies.

  • Fixed an issue that was causing part of the character to become invisible while changing cosmetics.

  • Updated descriptions of the ‚ÄúLightning Reflex‚Äù and ‚ÄúCounterattack‚Äù blessings to consistently use ‚ÄúPerfect Block‚Äù.

  • Fixed an issue where some lines in the Orthus Offensive mission would be inaudible.

  • Fixed the Zealot ‚ÄúHexorcist's Breeches‚Äù lowerbody cosmetic item having the wrong footstep modulation.¬†¬†

  • Fixed the incorrect inclusion of the Radio Operator in the ‚ÄúElitist‚Äù penance.¬†¬†

  • Fixed an issue where an incorrect skull icon would be shown in the Mission Request popup.¬†¬†

  • Fixed the icons for experience and Ordo dockets being in the wrong order on the Mission Terminal.¬†¬†

  • Difficulties can now be swapped by pressing on the diamond shapes in The Meat Grinder.¬†¬†

  • Fixed an issue where the ‚ÄúNew Weekly Contracts‚Äù notification would show up even when Sire Melk‚Äôs Requisitorium was not yet unlocked.¬†¬†

  • Increased the spacing between the text and the border on the right-hand side of the special condition text.¬†¬†

  • Lightened up the vignette effect on the zoomed-in view of the Mission Terminal in order to see more of the hive.¬†

  • Changed the default value of the settings for the companion nameplate: all player Companion nameplates are now visible by default in the Mourningstar.

  • Heavily reduced the pixelated effect from mission board thumbnails.

  • Fixed an issue where the skybox would occasionally be visible after completing a Campaign mission.

Auric Difficulty Changes

New High Intensity added which will be active during High Intensity missions on the Auric level difficulty; this change will bring higher enemy count and increased spawn rate, more frequently occurring specials and hordes spawning.

¬†

Dev Note: Auric used to be Damnation with the guarantee of modifiers with High Intensity applied, that intensity has been applied as a baseline to new Auric, thus missions on the Auric Board may now appear as both High Intensity and Non-High Intensity.

Cosmetic & Animation Fixes

  • Fixed an issue where parts of the Infantry, Helbore, and Recon Lasguns did not show with texture quality settings set to "High".

  • Fixed an issue where some Cyber-Mastiff animations were blending with the player character in End of Round poses.

  • Several improvements to player animations.

  • Fixed an issue causing swing trails to be missing on Shock Maul and Suppression Shield weapons.

  • Fixed an issue that was causing headgear to overlap and cover the entire head.

  • Fixed an issue where the lower plate and cloth on the Psyker ‚ÄúDetio's War Plate‚Äù upperbody cosmetic clips with the chest piece while crouching.¬†¬†

  • Fixed some deformation issues on the Psyker ‚ÄúVostroyan Chain Hood with Psykana Collar‚Äù headgear cosmetic.

  • Fixed an issue where the Veteran ‚ÄúOcular Augmetic and Blue Face Mask‚Äù headgear cosmetic would remove too much hair.

  • Fixed instances of hair clipping on the Veteran ‚ÄúWitchhunter's Hat with Mask‚Äù and Zealot ‚ÄúWitchhunter's Hat‚Äù headgear cosmetics.

Arbites Fixes & Tweaks

General Fixes

  • Updated localized description text for the following Arbites weapons.¬†¬†¬†

    • Exterminator Shotgun Mk III + VIII.

    • Subductor Shotpistol and Riot Shield.

  • Fixed a typo in the ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs Not Fair!‚Äù Arbites Commendations Character Creation option.

  • Fixed instances of the Arbites class occasionally using voice lines from other classes.

  • Fixed an issue where it was not possible to deploy a Nuncio-Aquila while sprinting.

  • Fixed an issue with Cyber-Mastiff nameplate being displayed in missions even though interface setting was set to off.

  • Fixed an issue with the position of the Arbites Shock Maul on Hadron's table on the Empower menu.

  • Fixed a crash that might occur when throwing grenades with an Arbites character during Basic Training.¬†¬†

  • Fixed an issue where the Cyber-Mastiff was spawning when looking at player cosmetics in the Commodore‚Äôs Vestures.

  • Fixed issue where 'Razor-Jaw Augment' didn't properly apply Bleed to all targets hit by the Pounce knockback.

  • Fixed an issue where Keeping Protocol talent was increasing damage to enemies other than Monstrosities.

  • Fixed an issue where the Shock Maul and Suppression Shield charge display was not showing any outline until the first bar was shown.

  • Fixed an issue where an incorrect message was displayed when changing the appearance of your Cyber-Mastiff in the Barber-Chirurgeon.

  • Fixed an issue where some enemy units were sliding on the floor after having been pounced by the Cyber-Mastiff.

  • Fixed an issue where the Nuncio Aquila effect failed to disappear in the end mission cutscene.

  • Fixed an issue that was causing the weapon rarity text to run off the UI window for the Exterminator Shotgun.

  • Fixed an issue where the Cyber-Mastiff could push Poxbursters even when not attacking anything.

Cosmetic & Animation Fixes

  • Fixed some clipping issues on both versions of the Arbites ‚ÄúArbitrator Revelatum Plate with Covert Ops Coat‚Äù upperbody cosmetic.¬†¬†

  • Fixed an issue where the Arbites Precinct-specific decals would not always be applied correctly onto the related upperbody cosmetics.¬†¬†

  • Fixed some issues with the Arbites Precinct-specific decals being stretched or cut off while being applied on the following upperbody cosmetic items.

    • Arbitrator Patrol Plate.

    • Arbitrator Proctor Plate.

  • Fixed an issue where the kneepads on the Arbites ‚ÄúArbitrator Revelatum Fatigues (Lucis)‚Äù lowerbody cosmetic would appear slightly detached from the knee while squatting.

  • Fixed an issue where the trinket attachment points were incorrectly placed on the Arbites ‚ÄúShock Maul and Suppression Shield‚Äù and ‚ÄúShock Maul‚Äù weapons.

  • Fixed an issue where blood effects were not being applied on the Shock Maul and Suppression Shield head.

  • Fixed an issue where human Backpacks were not available to the Arbites Class. Players who previously purchased any of the following premium cosmetics (backpacks) will now be able to equip them on their Arbitrator:

    • Pilgrim's Scroll Tube

    • Vox-Caster "Theta-901"

    • Enlightening Reading

    • Feretory With Sconces

  • Players who previously purchased any of the following premium cosmetics (implants) will now be able to equip them on their Arbitrator:

    • Spectrus VI Model Bionic Eye

    • MkIVz Occular Augmetic

    • MkIIg Occular Augmetic

    • Voicebox Rebreather (Osclum III Pattern)

    • Intra-Cranial Implant

We‚Äôll see you on the Mourningstar.¬†

‚Äì The Darktide Team

item.title: Hotfix 1.4.0.195 is live!
item.description:
Our tech-priests worked day and night to prepare another hotfix, Lord Captain!

Praise the Omnissiah, more errors were eliminated.

Please be aware of the plot spoilers below!

Note that https://steamcommunity.com/app/2186680/discussions/0/4027970580228219058/ always contains up-to-date information on known issues and the roadmap of upcoming patches.

Patch Notes:

  • Saves with the issues described in the hotfix 1.4.0.190 (arena in Commorragh and the Lord Captain remaining in a different form after Thassera) are now retroactively fixed;
  • The game could crash when entering Plundered Void Station if you already visited it before the DLC2 patch - fixed;
  • Fixed a number of visual issues with Chinese fonts;
  • Fixed desyncs in co-op related to the hologram of the familiar in combat;
  • Sometimes characters could move beyond the boundaries of the map on the Feudal World, walking through a wall - fixed;
  • Improved the elevator cutscene on the Feudal World;
  • Improved effect for the wall explosion on the Feudal World;
  • White color scheme was added for the Cyber-Eagle familiar;
  • A few broken dialogue options in Lex Imperialis were fixed and will now work correctly;
  • Cyber-Eagle abilities could remain after a respec when another familiar was chosen;
  • The Cyber-Eagle is now consistently returning to soaring above the battlefield at the end of its Overseer's turn;
  • Rite of Solar Nourishment now correctly grants +5 Agility to the Psyber-Raven;
  • The Psyber-Raven's Warp Buffer talent now works as intended, reallocating the Perils of Warp to the enemies. Behold the Unsanctioned Psyker!
  • The Psyber-Raven's Psy-Resonator talent now correctly regenerates +1 AP to the Overseer;
  • Servo-skull swarm Symbiosis talent now correctly regenerates +1 AP to the Overseer;
  • Fixed non-responsive controller buttons on the character screen;
  • Polishing updates to some portraits;
  • Sister Argenta can finally receive her Adepta Sororitas helmet that was seen in the trailers, but was lost during the original game release:



  • Beautiful flame effects were added to the Martyr shield and Last Stand shield:
